website_summaries.verdict: Brilliantly comfy on day one—is a great description for the Zen Pro Mid GTX. The Scarpa approach shoe in question can also be considered a precisely fitting hiker with A-grade water protection.This grippy mid-top shoe, however, is marred with a few mishaps, perhaps the most unamusing of which would have to be its below-standard toeing sensitivity. Nonetheless, the Zen Pro Mid GTX is another one of Scarpa’s greats, thanks to its convincing list of approach-focused qualities.
pros: Droves of reviews about the Scarpa Zen Pro Mid GTX tell of the shoe’s amazing level of comfort
It has a quick break-in phase, according to numerous sources
Based on quite a number of reports, this high-quality approach shoe has a true-to-size fit
The Scarpa Zen Pro Mid GTX approach hiking boot is impressively waterproof, say many of those who have bought it
Several wearers find this approach-centric hiker from Scarpa incredibly supportive around the ankle
Many patrons adore the Zen Pro Mid GTX’s super-sticky outsole deeply
Its lightness is fantastic, about a handful of outdoorsy folks claim
cons: According to a user, its forefoot (toe box) could be a bit more sensitive
The upper of this Scarpa offering is a dirt magnet, based on a review
An owner finds its laces too short

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic boots
customer_reviews.text: Extremely well manufactured boots - all the sewing and sticking is top notch with no no stitch out of line or smeared glue. The boots feel rock solid and pretty well padded on the inside. All my other hiking boots/shoes seemed like poorly made toys compared to this. Sizing works just about right for me. Unfortunately I got tripped by trying a pair of Scarpa crux that were running small and ordered the Zen 1/2 size larger and they were too large (my measured size is slightly above 10 and I usually wear 10 or 10.5 depending on the manufacturer or model. I ordered 11 and felt like I was wearing clown boots). Will end up reordering a smaller size.
customer_reviews.author: Macaccus Rhesus

customer_reviews.title: The best field boots I've found
customer_reviews.text: These boots are light weight, water proof, and require no break in period. I literally went strait into the field with no prior use for a week and had no blisters. I do use wool socks which as a geologist I have learned my feet are the number one priority so I spare no expense on them. I usually wear a 10.5 to 11 depending and I got an 11 in these since I wear the wool socks which are larger. They fit great, I would not have wanted them any smaller.
customer_reviews.author: Juja Z.

customer_reviews.title: Great for Scrambling
customer_reviews.text: I just used my Scarpa Zen Pro Mid GTX to hike the 8.2 mile Huntington Ravine to Lion Head loop on Mount Washington in NH. This included the infamous scramble up the talus field (the "fan"), then the "slab" and finally the "chimney" of the Huntington Ravine headwall. The Zen were great for this scramble, being able to smear and edge rather well. But the Zen were also very comfortable for this medium-distance hike. Over the years I've hiked in a great many boots, and these are definitely among the best. They seem to be good at almost any task you throw at them.
customer_reviews.author: 3Bikes

customer_reviews.title: Scarpa Quality
customer_reviews.text: I'm a regular Scarpa user, I have mountain boots, ski boots, approach shoes and climbing shoes. These live up to the Scarpa bombproof reputation. Comfortable right out of the box I didn't even know I was wearing them. Grippy on all surfaces, even decent on hard snow. Not bad climbers, but a tad clunky because they're burly. These will be my go to shoes for this Sierra summer season hiking and scrambling in the high peaks.
customer_reviews.author: Chris J. Owen

customer_reviews.title: New favorites!
customer_reviews.text: I already own 7 other pairs of Scarpa boots/shoes....but these are quickly becoming my favorites! Comfortable right out of the box....and VERY well constructed! As with most Scarpa's, the insoles leave a bit to be desired, but Dr Scholls fixes that up for $12. I use these for walking, not hiking....Scarpa has MUCH better options for hiking. These are too light, and not waterproof.....for "real" hiking....but they are quality boots, nonetheless! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Scott B.

customer_reviews.title: Great ascent/hiking shoes
customer_reviews.text: Great ascent/hiking shoes. The factory inserts aren't impressive. I immediately replaced w powerstep inserts. Took a little break in time on the ankles. I anticipated this since I tend to sprain the are worth the break in soreness. Very solid platform and ankle support.
customer_reviews.author: kapb

customer_reviews.title: On my second pair!
customer_reviews.text: Love these boots. They offer superior support with a good looking, comfortable fit. Take a bit to break in, but so worth it. Feel like a mountain goat in these boots, i have solid footing on rock face while the other hikers struggle with their footing. You ch er more than you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: details13

customer_reviews.title: Blisters galore
customer_reviews.text: Disclaimer I’m prone to blisters. But I’ve never done so like w these. 20 min walk w the dog had me w two dime size on each heel. Otherwise seemed great
customer_reviews.author: Swens

customer_reviews.title: Scarpa Shoes do not disappoint. To make sure they fit properly
customer_reviews.text: Scarpa Shoes do not disappoint. To make sure they fit properly, get fitted for a pair of converse low tops and then check the sizes on the inside tongue of them and that's exactly the size to get for a pair of Scarpa's.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Whittier

customer_reviews.title: Great boot right out of the box.
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love these boots, I normally have to use a boot stretcher to get my hiking boots to fit correctly. These fit perfectly out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: Clifford L Owens

customer_reviews.title: Great approach shoe with ankle support.
customer_reviews.text: Great for approach and standing in aiders all day. Lighter than my Boulder X. Confident to switch to easy/moderate free climbing in them too. Probably not great for tiny edging, but sticky enough to work great when smearing on tiny granite crystals and desert sandstone.
customer_reviews.author: Aloha Salt Lake

customer_reviews.title: Great boots
customer_reviews.text: These are solid hiking boots. A little on the heavy side, but you get the support you need and features you'd expect for the extra weight. Would definitely order again.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Jones

customer_reviews.title: Great fit for real medium foot.
customer_reviews.text: Review is for great fit on brand new boots. Usually wear 10.5 US and went with 44 EU. The boot 'last' with slightly wider toe box was just right. Good ankle support from stiffer sole for light packing.
customer_reviews.author: James Powell

customer_reviews.title: The size was perfect, No brake in period comfortable from day one
customer_reviews.text: The size was perfect, No brake in period comfortable from day one. I live in wisconsin and walk the dog in them everyday and they keep my feet dry and warm. They might be a little to warm in the summer not sure yet.
customer_reviews.author: mike bauer

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable out of the box
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable out of the box. Nimble but has all the reinforcement in the right places. Im ordering the shoes because the value is better than expected.
customer_reviews.author: TJ Sabo

customer_reviews.title: These boots are simply brilliant. Light
customer_reviews.text: These boots are simply brilliant. Light, asymmetrical, perfect fitting, breathable, tough, grippy, and sporty. For any hiking short of needing crampons, these are the ticket.
customer_reviews.author: Peter M. Tousignant

customer_reviews.title: Love Scarpa PRO
customer_reviews.text: This is the second pair of Scarpa boots I have owned, also a pair of hiking shoes. they are great,sturdy and fit perfectly. these sit just above the ankle and I like the elastic holding the tongue in place. the footbed is solid, as expected, and on my feet all day and did not want to take them off. a note on Scarpa, if you buy the PRO quality they are made in europe, these were Romanian, the lesser quality are now made in China and the quality shows. My hiking shoes were Chinese and the lining wore out inside 5 months, and the fit is not as good as these PRO boots.
customer_reviews.author: Debra D.

customer_reviews.title: Good width. The volume in the forefoot is a ...
customer_reviews.text: Good width. The volume in the forefoot is a little lower than I like...but probably by design since this is an approach shoe for climbing.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew CH Bain

customer_reviews.title: Great Boot
customer_reviews.text: The fit was perfect for me I had to add a gel insert I just need a lot of cushion, very well made I wear them for every day use work and play. I think they will do well in cold weather also. So far I think they are a great boot and should hold up for some time I am very hard on my shoes, also love the lace to toe.
customer_reviews.author: dave

customer_reviews.title: With SuperFeet insoles perfect fit. I've been wearing these new boots all ...
customer_reviews.text: With SuperFeet insoles perfect fit. I've been wearing these new boots all day long since day one without any problems. I like the Vibram soles, good flex and quiet walking.
customer_reviews.author: James Lea

customer_reviews.title: I have literally traveled the globe in these and they are great!
customer_reviews.text: Due to extended work travel, I have been wearing these boots every day for the last 2 weeks for 10-14 hours and haven't worn any other shoes. They were brand new and arrived two days before I left. I started in Texas, traveled through Toronto and Goose Bay, Canada, Iceland, Greenland, Scotland and am presently sitting in Crete. They have been comfortable, broke in fast, and I would absolutely recommend them. Great boots. Warm, comfortable, supportive, and look damn goos sipping scotch in a bad in Germany. 5 out of 5.
customer_reviews.author: Steve in Texas

customer_reviews.title: The grip is good on the soles and it has good ankle support ...
customer_reviews.text: Fits ok for up hills but down hill hikes are a disaster for my feet, especially in the toe box for my small toes. The grip is good on the soles and it has good ankle support but the lacing is also not great. Really disappointing for an expensive boot
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy D. Footer

customer_reviews.title: Uncomfortable.  Expected much more from a $200 hiking boot.
customer_reviews.text: Really wanted to love these. I love the look. But, essentially zero cushion in the sole. Even with cushioned wool socks, the pressure in the ball of the foot area was very uncomfortable and uneven feeling. I would have kept them in hopes of the sole breaking in a bit but the biggest issue was the seam at the top where the tongue attaches to the side of the inside of the boot. Very sharp and hard. I had a blister forming on the inside of my ankle just from walking around the house.
customer_reviews.author: cmcpolo

customer_reviews.title: Love the look and feel and they stick to the ...
customer_reviews.text: Love the look and feel and they stick to the rocks well. BLISTERS constant blisters. Every time I wear these I get a blister on my big toe and or my pinky toe. I have tried diferetn socks, fifferent trails. Doesn't mater Blisters. I will write the company a letter to see if I can return and get back the 165.00 they cost. I've only got them 1 month ago.
customer_reviews.author: tom reeder

product_meta.title: Scarpa Men’s Zen Pro Mid GTX-m
product_meta.description: The supportive comfort, reliable protection, and grippy outsole of the Scarpa® Zen Pro Mid GTX® lets you hike and climb with total ease. Suede upper with injected TPU reinforcements on the side for durability. GORE-TEX® Extended Comfort liner keeps out the wet elements while offering comfortable breathability for year-round use. Traditional lace-up design for a secure fit. Heel pull loop. Higher profile boot design protects the ankle from abrasions and scrapes. Sock-Fit XT technology offers a comfortable fit and added sensitivity. Cushioned P-Flex insole provides excellent flexibility and underfoot support. Protective rubber toe and heel randing. Injected EVA cushioned midsole provides supportive comfort for all-day adventures. Vibram Spyder II sticky rubber outsole provides excellent grip on various terrain. Built on the BN last. Imported. Measurements: Heel Height: 1 3⁄4 in Weight: 1 lb 7 oz Shaft: 5 in Platform Height: 1⁄2 in Product measurements were taken using size 46 (US Men's 12), width D - Medium. Please note that measurements may vary by size. Weight of footwear is based on a single item, not a pair.
feature_bullets: Mid-cut hiking boot with suede upper featuring injected TPU reinforcements and Sock-Fit XT technology;Protective rubber toe and heel randing;Heel pull loop;Waterproof GORE-TEX liner;Injected EVA cushioned midsole
